result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathen D. Heath

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathen D. Heath not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Letter on file requesting new date. DE in custody. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Requesting a reset of 10/26 date- Defense

Defendant Jonathen D. Heath appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jonathen D. Heath.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea s entered by counsel.  Speedy trial reserved.  Case No. 22CF364 to be scheduled for same Status date in October.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
2:12 PM (64-05)Defendant Jonathen D. Heath appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jonathen D. Heath. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Benjamin Lefevere City of Elkhorn, P.D. Witness has identified the defendant on the video screen in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. 
Exhibit #1 offered. Attorney Prudent objects to the court receiving Exhibit #1, states reasons.
Court will receive Exhibit #1 into evidence.
State is requesting the court to take judicial notice of the defendant's other files. Attorney Pruden objects.
Court will exclude taking judicial notice of the defendant's other files and states reasons on the record.
2:21PM - Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann, requesting bind over.
No argument by Attorney Pruden.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 

State is requesting 30 days for Arraignment .


Judge Reddy needs to be recused, defendant was terminated from Drug Court. New Judge needs to be assigned.


Adj 2:23PM
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22CF404 & 22CF364

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.S.C. dob 8-9-1980 or H.L.J. dob 10-12-1984 or residences. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

2:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Jonathen D. Heath appeared by video.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jonathen D. Heath. 
Attorney Pruden acknowledged receipt of the Complaint, waived reading and requests a Preliminary Hearing.

BOND TO COVER BOTH FILES, SAME PRIOR CONDITIONS. 22CF364 & 22CF404


Adj. 2:04PM
